premise: Two young children playing outside.
hypothesis: Two kids played.
explanation_1: the kids are outside

premise: A man wearing black pants and a white shirt stands in front of a building with signs written in some kind of Asian characters.
hypothesis: a man stands in front of a building
explanation_1: A man stands in front of a building which is identified with signs written in Asian characters.

premise: Young woman in a costume appears to be participating in a parade or dance.
hypothesis: There is a woman.
explanation_1: Young woman is a woman.

premise: A group of dogs run through the snowy field.
hypothesis: Dogs run through the field.
explanation_1: There are a group of dogs, indicating that there is more than one dog that's running through a field.

premise: A crowd sits along side a building as a man talks to them and another group of men hang out nearby on a sidewalk.
hypothesis: Crowd sits along a building side
explanation_1: The crowd sits alongside a building and a man talks to them in the first statement while in the second the crowd sits along a building side

premise: A man in swimming shorts is jumping off a cliff into a body of water.
hypothesis: A man is jumping off a cliff.
explanation_1: "A man is jumping off a cliff" is a less detailed way of describing the man in swimming shorts jumping into a body of water

premise: Two woman smile at the camera while enjoying their lunch together.
hypothesis: A couple of women smile at the camera.
explanation_1: A couple, in this context, means two, so a couple of women smile at the camera is another way of saying two women smile at the camera.

premise: A mustachioed man operates a piece of heavy construction equipment from the cab.
hypothesis: A man is operating equipment.
explanation_1: The second sentence does not describe the equipment but states equipment

premise: Four men play a frisbee game on a grass field.
hypothesis: Four men play a game.
explanation_1: A frisbee game is a game.

premise: A young child dressed in a yellow plaid shirt and a blue hat, sits and stares out at the water.
hypothesis: A child stares out at the water.
explanation_1: A child who stares out at water does just that.

premise: A older man wearing a bandanna on and a biker shirt.
hypothesis: The man is older.
explanation_1: The man is older which refers to older man wearing a bandanna on and biker shirt.

premise: A woman is outside playing the guitar.
hypothesis: A woman is using her hands to play a guitar.
explanation_1: A woman could be outside playing a guitar.

premise: Two men are walking along side the ocean carrying a fishing pole.
hypothesis: There are two men in this picture
explanation_1: There are two men walking along the ocean in a picture.

premise: A group of ladies looking at a booth set up at a popular venue.
hypothesis: A group of ladies looking at something.
explanation_1: A booth is something.

premise: The girl is talking on her cellphone while skating down the street.
hypothesis: The girl is outdoors.
explanation_1: The girl must be outdoors to skate down the street.

premise: A young person feeds a small animal with a bottle.
hypothesis: The child was feeding an animal.
explanation_1: A young person is a child.

premise: People with umbrellas walk down a busy street.
hypothesis: There are people outdoors with umbrellas.
explanation_1: A street is outdoors.

premise: A young boy in blue, kicking a ball while other boys watch.
hypothesis: a boy is kicking
explanation_1: The boy kicking the ball is mentioned in both contexts.

premise: Two gentlemen enjoying a drink at bar.
hypothesis: Two men are sitting at a bar, drinking.
explanation_1: Two men are drinking because they are enjoying a drink.

premise: Person mid-jump on a mountain biking course, in the air surrounded by trees.
hypothesis: The person is outside.
explanation_1: It is likely that a person is outside if they are in the air surrounded by trees.

premise: An older man dressed in blue overalls and glasses, is standing in a shop with many tools, holding several small pieces of wood.
hypothesis: A male is in a workshop building.
explanation_1: a workshop has many tools

premise: Woman sitting on a turquoise bench with a pillow and a bag near a restaurant.
hypothesis: Woman is outside on a bench.
explanation_1: outside refers to sitting on a bench

premise: A group of African women and children wearing brightly colored clothes.
hypothesis: Several people gathered.
explanation_1: Group implies several.

premise: A white and brown dog is walking through the water.
hypothesis: A dog walking through water.
explanation_1: The dog is walking through the water.

premise: a young girl wearing a green fairy costume riding a bigwheels
hypothesis: The girl is young.
explanation_1: A young girl means the girl is young.

premise: A man in a red sweatshirt and a hat is looking at his phone while another man in black walks closer to him down the sidewalk.
hypothesis: Two men walking on the sidewalk outdoors.
explanation_1: down the sidewalk implies that they are walking outdoors.

premise: A woman and a man sit on a stone bench, with tall buildings behind them.
hypothesis: Two people sitting on a bench.
explanation_1: A woman and man are two people.

premise: An older man wearing ice skates and holding a hockey stick looks at a hockey puck in midair.
hypothesis: A man is playing hockey.
explanation_1: A man is playing with his hockey stick.

premise: Man in green jacket driving a green street cleaning machine.
hypothesis: Man is doing his job
explanation_1: Man in green jacket is a type of man, and driving a green street cleaning machine shows doing his job.

premise: Four adults practicing lifting in a wooded area in front of spectators
hypothesis: People are practicing lifting while others watch.
explanation_1: Four adults constitute a group of people, and if they are in front of spectators, they are doing something while others watch.

premise: The man reading a magazine is sitting in the large room.
hypothesis: the man is indoors.
explanation_1: A man sitting in the large room is indoors.

premise: Dog runs through field of flowers
hypothesis: Dog is running through flowers outside
explanation_1: A field implies being outside.

premise: A man squatting in front a pile of objects.
hypothesis: A man is outside.
explanation_1: The man can be squatting inside and not outside.

premise: Female wearing a pink helmet, white shirt and white gym shorts, parking her motorcycle along side a busy sidewalk cafe.
hypothesis: A woman meeting up with a friend at a cafe.
explanation_1: Parking a motorcycle does not imply meeting up with a friend.

premise: A young child raises her arms while jumping on a yellow blow-up toy.
hypothesis: A child jumps on a beach ball.
explanation_1: Not all blow-up toy is a beach ball.

premise: Two brown dogs are wearing muzzles and running very fast through the grass.
hypothesis: Two brown dogs are playing with each other.
explanation_1: The dogs wearing muzzles are not necessarily running because they are playing with each other.

premise: 2 men stand in line at a restaurant.
hypothesis: Two friends stand in line together at a restaurant.
explanation_1: Just that two men are standing in a line together at a restaurant doesn't imply they are friends.

premise: Adults are sitting in chairs in a native hut watching children perform.
hypothesis: The adults are all watching the young children perform their first ritual dance
explanation_1: Children could be performing anything besides their first ritual dance.

premise: A man in a white shirt crossing the street in a city holding a guitar.
hypothesis: A man heading to a performance.
explanation_1: There is nothing to indicate that the man is heading to a performance.

premise: A man is diving into water on a slightly cloudy day.
hypothesis: The man is diving into a lake.
explanation_1: A body of water can be other things than a lake.

premise: A child is walking along a stone pathway.
hypothesis: A kid is following his parents.
explanation_1: Walking does not imply following.

premise: A beautiful woman in a nice dress is standing on what could be a Mardi Gras float.
hypothesis: A woman in a dress hanging out with her friends.
explanation_1: A woman in a nice dress is not necessarily hanging out with her friends.

premise: An older man sitting at a lighted workbench.
hypothesis: The man is a carpenter.
explanation_1: Just because there is a workbench does not mean the man is a carpenter.

premise: A man is catching air while snowboarding.
hypothesis: The man is racing down the snowy slope.
explanation_1: Just because a man is catching air while snowboarding, it doesn't necessarily mean that he is racing down the snowy slope.

premise: These young ladies are sitting comfortable discussing their food or talking about the woman.
hypothesis: The women are friends.
explanation_1: Just because they are talking together does not mean they are friends.

premise: A large brown dog is running through a grassy backyard.
hypothesis: The dog is chasing a ball around.
explanation_1: The dog could be running through the grass for reasons unrelated to a ball.

premise: A crowd of people is walking through a parking lot at night.
hypothesis: There are people figuring out where to go.
explanation_1: the people are not necessarily figuring out a destination

premise: Two children with face paint sitting on the ground in front of a window.
hypothesis: The children is in a children's party.
explanation_1: A children's party is not the only place to use face paint.

premise: Two people in hard hats and safety vests working with cable in a grassy area.
hypothesis: They are both men
explanation_1: Two people wearing hard hats doesn't imply they are men.

premise: A man with a bald head is standing in the street as other walk around at an event.
hypothesis: A man at a street festival.
explanation_1: Just because a man is standing in the street at an event, it does not mean he is at a street festival.

premise: A woman standing on the side of a very inclined road.
hypothesis: A woman has a flat tire.
explanation_1: Standing on the side of a inclined road does not indicate that the person has flat tire

premise: A group of 11 smiling kids and young teens are divided into two groups, in a large, indoor swimming pool, with the back person in each group holding their arms up.
hypothesis: Two teams play water polo indoors.
explanation_1: Not all people play water polo

premise: An asian woman is sitting on the floor inside holding a purse made from palm fronds.
hypothesis: The woman handmade the purse while sitting on the floor.
explanation_1: The woman didn't necessarily handmade the purse while sitting on the floor, the purse she's holding could be manufactured by machines in a factory.

premise: A man dressed in red and white plays a banjo while others look on.
hypothesis: A man plays the a banjo for a crowd of onlookers.
explanation_1: A man playing a banjo is not necessarily for a crowd of onlookers.

premise: A little boy is attempting to do a cartwheel.
hypothesis: The young boy is upside down.
explanation_1: A boy attempting a cartwheel can find himself in a variety of postures and is not necessarily upside down.

premise: Three men in work-related uniforms standing next to a building.
hypothesis: Several men prepare for a day of work.
explanation_1: You can be standing next to a building and not prepare for something.

premise: A skilled bike rider navigates a thin course suspended over marshy swampland.
hypothesis: The marshy swampland has alligators in it.
explanation_1: Swamps don't necessarily have alligators in it.

premise: Two elderly women are sitting outside a front door on two lawn chairs.
hypothesis: Some huge people sitting.
explanation_1: Not all elderly women are huge.

premise: A man tries to get a toy away from a small dog.
hypothesis: They are playing
explanation_1: Just because they man is trying to get a toy away from the dog does not insinuate they are playing.

premise: A young girl wearing a pink and white dress with a crown of pink and yellow roses makes a funny face.
hypothesis: A little girl is wearing a dress from her parents.
explanation_1: just because a young girl wearing a pink and white dress doesn't mean she is wearing a dress from her parents.

premise: A man stands on top of a large pile of rocks with a bicycle and wagon in the foreground.
hypothesis: The man is tall
explanation_1: Even though he is on top rocks does not mean the man is tall.

premise: A young woman in a yellow bathing suit laying on a surfboard observes a surfing lesson.
hypothesis: A woman pretending to be tired to avoid a surfing lesson
explanation_1: We do not know the reason that the young woman is is laying on the surfboard. She may not be pretending to be tired.

premise: A young boy pulling down his eyeglasses and looking a toy trains
hypothesis: a boy has eye problems and takes his glasses off to see the train
explanation_1: It might not be true that the boy has eye problems, and he may have other reasons for taking the glasses off besides to see the train.

premise: A crowd of people watching a concert.
hypothesis: People attend a rap concert.
explanation_1: Just because crowd of people watching a concert doesn't needed to be a rap concert

premise: A man sits in a white plastic chair outside a small building.
hypothesis: A man standing outside a restaurant.
explanation_1: one either sits or is standing, not both

premise: A little boy playing in a water spout.
hypothesis: the little girl plays with her guitar inside
explanation_1: sentence two can not be about a little girl if sentence one is about a little boy

premise: A woman is covering the eyes of another woman and both women are laughing.
hypothesis: Two women cross their arms and argue at eachother.
explanation_1: Two women can't argue while they are both laughing.

premise: Two men each holding their dog on leashes as the two dogs play with each other.
hypothesis: Two dogs are running through a field while one man runs after them.
explanation_1: The men can't be holding their dog on leashes and letting them run through a field at the same time.

premise: A person in winter gear is riding a bike near an intersection.
hypothesis: The person is in a boat wearing a bikini.
explanation_1: A person can either be in a boat or be riding a bike.

premise: A group of boys playing outside with each other while another watches.
hypothesis: A group of boys playing video games indoors.
explanation_1: They cannot be playing outside and playing video games indoors at the same time.

premise: Rear view of dark-skinned woman walking on sidewalk near artwork that is on display.
hypothesis: A woman dances on the stage.
explanation_1: The woman cannot walk on the side walk and dance on the stage simultaneously.

premise: A man in a black shirt and jeans is walking by the sea.
hypothesis: the man is jumping
explanation_1: Walking and jumping are different activities.

premise: There are four people dressed in orange clothes walking down the street.
hypothesis: Four people are seated together at a picnic table having lunch.
explanation_1: The four people cannot be walking down the street and sitting at a picnic table at the same time.

premise: A young boy playing next to a sleeping dog on the floor.
hypothesis: The boy is playing with the dog.
explanation_1: A boy would not be playing with a sleeping dog.

premise: A man is standing on a subway leaning against a pole.
hypothesis: The man hailed a cab to work this morning.
explanation_1: A man can only use one mode of transportation - either he hailed a cab or used the subway.

premise: A man and woman pose in front of some traffic.
hypothesis: A man and a woman stand on top of a mountain.
explanation_1: The people cannot be both posing in front of traffic and also standing on top of a mountain.

premise: A woman in blue shorts and white shirt holds a tennis racket on a blue tennis court.
hypothesis: The woman is playing field hockey.
explanation_1: Playing field hockey isn't on a tennis court.

premise: A man stands behind some merchandise in an area with lots of candles.
hypothesis: a woman eats a sandwich in a cafe
explanation_1: A man is not the same as a woman. The man is by merchandise and candles, not at a café eating a sandwich.

premise: People milling around acting as if they are waiting for an answer from someone or something.
hypothesis: a class sits attentively
explanation_1: One cannot be milling around while sitting attentively.

premise: A baby being held by a small girl, swimming underwater in a blue pool.
hypothesis: Two kids are sitting next to a pool.
explanation_1: The kids cannot be swimming underwater while simultaneously sitting next to the pool.

premise: A dog is running through the snow.
hypothesis: The animals are laying in the yard
explanation_1: A dog running through the snow can not be laying in the yard.

premise: Two men are sitting in chairs in front of a building while a group of people climb a set of steps.
hypothesis: mens are watching the dance of people.
explanation_1: Two men sitting in chairs in front of a building while a group of people climb a set of steps has no reference to men watching the dance of people.

premise: Woman standing barefoot near a small hut and filling a jug with liquid.
hypothesis: A woman inside on the couch.
explanation_1: A HUT IS NOT A COUCH

premise: A man riding a bicycle performs a trick above a dirt mound.
hypothesis: The man is walking on a dirt mound.
explanation_1: A man can't be on and above at the same time.

premise: Two men at a concert performing for an audience.
hypothesis: Two men are cleaning out a garage so they can pull in a new car.
explanation_1: An audience would not fit in a garage, nor would they want to watch two men clean it out.

premise: A boy is holding a toy car and looking intently at a tree trunk.
hypothesis: A boy takes a nap.
explanation_1: A boy cannot be looking at a tree trunk and taking a nap at the same time.

premise: An older woman is placing a cloth over items on a table.
hypothesis: A man is doing a magic trick
explanation_1: A woman cannot also be a man.

premise: Four young trendy women sitting and talking in a public place.
hypothesis: four women sleeping in a tent
explanation_1: Women cannot talk to each other and sleep at the same time.

premise: Three boys diving into a lake.
hypothesis: Three boys running
explanation_1: The boys are diving, not running.

premise: A little girl walking down a dirt road behind a group of other walkers.
hypothesis: A girl is riding a bicycle down a grassy hill.
explanation_1: If one is walking on a dirt road, they are not riding a bicycle down a grassy hill.

premise: An Asian man is cutting some meat on a cutting board in a kitchen and he is wearing a long blue t-shirt.
hypothesis: the wind and rain is beating heavily on the man's bare chest
explanation_1: A man cannot be on his bare chest the same time his wearing a shirt.

premise: A man wearing a white shirt has both his arms in the air
hypothesis: A woman is cheering at a game.
explanation_1: A man and woman are different genders.

premise: A black dog on a rocky beach.
hypothesis: girl eats ice cream
explanation_1: A dog is not consistent with a girl.

premise: Two women are wearing red ethnic costumes, with a Chinese building and a mountain in the background.
hypothesis: Two men wearing swimsuits try to crash a parade.
explanation_1: 2 men cannot be 2 women

premise: A man standing by the trees working.
hypothesis: A man sitting under a big tree drinking some water.
explanation_1: A man can either be standing or sitting.

premise: A person wearing a purple shirt stands on a skateboard at the top of a small stairway.
hypothesis: A person in a black shirt running a marathon.
explanation_1: The shirt can be either purple or black.  A person who stands on a skateboard cannot be running at the same time.
